metadata.title: USN-3264-1 -- Linux kernel vulnerability
metadata.description: Alexander Popov discovered that a race condition existed in the Stream Control Transmission Protocol (SCTP) implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-3264-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-image-3.13.0-117-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-117.164 linux-image-3.13.0-117-lowlatency - 3.13.0-117.164 linux-image-extra-3.13.0-117-generic - 3.13.0-117.164 linux-image-3.13.0-117-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-117.164 linux-image-3.13.0-117-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-117.164 linux-image-3.13.0-117-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-117.164 linux-image-3.13.0-117-generic - 3.13.0-117.164 linux-image-3.13.0-117-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-117.164 linux-image-3.13.0-117-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-117.164 No subscription required
